parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.70</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a string containing a line break, similar to [[lineBreak]] for [[text]]. The name is inspired by c++ std::endl ('''end''' '''l'''ine). The command returns "\r\n", which contains control characters rather than printable characters:  
* <tt>[[hint]] [[str]] [[count]] "\r\n"; // 4</tt>
* <tt>[[hint]] [[str]] [[count]] [[endl]]; // 2</tt>
The line break works for [[diag_log]] and [[ctrlSetText]]. It doesn't work with the [[hint]] because [[hint]] interprets printable "\n" as line break instead. Alternatively one can use [[toString]] command to get other characters.
 </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''endl''' </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] - line break </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[diag_log]] ("line1" + [[endl]] + "line2");</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_ctrl = [[findDisplay]] 46 [[ctrlCreate]] ["RscTextMulti", -1]; 
_ctrl [[ctrlSetPosition]] [0,0,1,1]; 
_ctrl [[ctrlCommit]] 0; 
_ctrl [[ctrlSetText]] [[format]] ["line1%1line2%1line3", [[endl]]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[lineBreak]], [[str]], [[format]], [[toString]], [[joinString]], [[splitString]], [[toArray]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 15, 2020 - 11:50 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:7erra|7erra]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
<template lineStart="1"><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[toArray]] [[endl]]</value></part></template> results in <template><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[13, 10]</value></part></template>. <template><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[toString]] [13, 10]</value></part></template> is therefore equivalent (or at least very similar) to [[endl]].
</dd>
</dl>
